sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Denis Studennikov)
articles.description: In this article, we will be taking a closer look at a design case study and discuss possible reasons why its customers abandon their online shopping carts and what solutions are recommended in each particular case.
articles.title: How Even Small UX Changes Can Result In An Increase In Conversion (A Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Smart SVG techniques, from generative SVG grids to SVG paths with masks, grainy SVG gradients, cut-out effects and fractional SVG stars. Let‚Äôs look at some magical SVG techniques that you can use right away.
articles.title: Magical SVG Techniques

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Barry Pollard)
articles.description: At the end of 2021, the Chrome team shipped some functionality that has the ability to make or break sites meeting the Core Web Vitals. So, let‚Äôs learn a little bit more about the Back/Forward Cache (aka bfcache), and what you can do to test if your website is compatible with it.
articles.title: Performance Game Changer: Browser Back/Forward Cache

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joshua Mauldin)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs explore how to give and receive better feedback when working remotely ‚Äî feedback that is actionable, specific, kind, and that won‚Äôt set you on edge. We‚Äôll start by explaining when feedback sessions don‚Äôt work and how to prevent it.
articles.title: How To Give Effective Feedback Remotely

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stefan Baumgartner)
articles.description: When deploying websites, there‚Äôs rarely a one-size-fits-all solution. Some websites benefit from server-rendered pages, some prefer statically generating content upfront. In this article, Stefan explains how a CMS such as [Storyblok](https://www.storyblok.com/) can help you make your site more resilient without losing the flexibility to deliver time-relevant content.
articles.title: Resilience, Flexibility And Immediacy: Working With Headless Systems

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: How difficult can it be to design a bulletproof language selector? It‚Äôs not as straightforward as one might think. We need to avoid redirects, decouple our language and country presets, allow for overrides, and use non-modal windows. Let‚Äôs dive in!
articles.title: Designing A Better Language Selector

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Josh Comeau)
articles.description: Developers often reach for UI frameworks like Bootstrap or Material UI, hoping that they‚Äôll save a bunch of time and quickly build a professional-looking app. Unfortunately, things rarely work out this way. Let‚Äôs talk about it.
articles.title: You Don‚Äôt Need A UI Framework

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs welcome May with a new collection of wallpapers. Designed with love by artists and designers from across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for May 2022.
articles.title: Make A Wish (May 2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Steve Sewell)
articles.description: Introducing Partytown, a lightweight open-source solution that reduces execution delays due to third-party JavaScript by offloading third-party scripts to web workers, which run in background threads.
articles.title: How Partytown Eliminates Website Bloat From Third-Party Scripts

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nathan Smith)
articles.description: In this article, Nathan Smith explains how to create modal dialog windows with rich interaction that will only require authoring HTML in order to be used. They are based on Web Components that are currently supported by every major browser.
articles.title: CTA Modal: How To Build A Web Component

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: We should be able to measure how well a particular design solves a particular problem. Let‚Äôs explore design KPIs that capture user‚Äôs experience, how to measure them and how to keep both users and business stakeholders happy, over time.
articles.title: Boosting UX With Design KPIs

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ceara Crawshaw)
articles.description: When bad UX has lingered in a product for so long, it can feel like a mountain to overcome. In this article, Ceara Crawshaw shares her advice on how you can invoke joy and assure the quality in the work done on product teams.
articles.title: Preventing Bad UX Through Integrated Design Workflows

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: In this article, Jhey Tompkins explores one of GreenSocks‚Äô newest plugins alongside React to create an impractical whimsical spin on a well-known native element: ``.
articles.title: What If Our Sliders Actually Slid?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Georgy Marchuk)
articles.description: Have you ever wondered, why do people write CLI tools? When is a good time to think about yours? Today we‚Äôll touch on these questions, along with some tips to remember when creating one. However, all of this serves as a prelude to the real topic: end-to-end testing of CLI tools.
articles.title: Testing The CLI The Way People Use It

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: In UX, we can use navigation queries, evaluation journeys, A-Z index and tap-ahead autocomplete to help users get where they want to be, faster. Let‚Äôs find out how.
articles.title: Designing Better Navigation With Navigation Queries

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Who doesn‚Äôt love a good timesaver? In this post, we compiled useful productivity tips and tools that help you speed up routine tasks, enhance your development workflow, and stay organized.
articles.title: Productivity Tips And Tools For A More Efficient Workflow

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ekene Eze)
articles.description: In this article, Ekene Eze shares his thoughts about the direction of the web in 2022, and what solutions we can expect to see come up in the ecosystem to significantly improve the Jamstack experience.
articles.title: Jamstack Rendering Patterns: The Evolution

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lee Munroe)
articles.description: What are the benefits of using push notifications and what can you use them for? In this article, Lee Munroe explains how to implement them and which practices are best to follow.
articles.title: The Ultimate Guide To Push Notifications For Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Marli Mesibov)
articles.description: Storytelling is a powerful tool for any UX designer. It helps create a product and understand the people who use it. In this article, Marli Mesibov takes a real-life example of an app she helped to build in 2017 and explains five steps you can use to help you build a story into your user experience.
articles.title: How To Use Storytelling In UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: Whether you work in-house or run a digital agency, there are occasions when you will consider hiring freelancers to supplement your team. Today, we‚Äôll take a look into a platform known as [Upwork](https://upwork.pxf.io/c/1221738/1245573/13634) and the best ways in finding the the right freelancers as well as integrating them into your team.
articles.title: When And How To Use Freelancers In Your Organization

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Carousels don‚Äôt have a good reputation, and rightfully so. But we can make them more useful. **Best practices and guidelines** to improve the carousel design with honest scrolling direction, labels, thumbnails and grouped prev/next-buttons.
articles.title: Designing A Better Carousel UX
